intro: Cyperus calochrous, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale to brownish flowers. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in the Americas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
